content.description:
Please note, I did not write this, taken from popular topo of the route. The author is unknown to me. I will gladly remove if not allowed.  Just trying to help share information on this route.

P1 30m 5.8 - 9 bolts
Climb up and left out of a cave clipping bolts to the top of a pedestal. Step left around the Arete and back right following bolts up to a large belay ledge above.

P2 30m 5.8 - 11 bolts
Climb left of the belay and up to a bolt above. Follow bolts up to a belay stance.

P3 20m 5.7 - 5 bolts
Climb above belay following four bolts to a grassy ledge. Traverse left and look for a bolt on the face. Climb up to the bolts and make a short traverse left to belay.

P4 25m 5.7 - 7 bolts
Move left around a large roof through a small overhang and carry on up to belay above. It is possible to rappel from this point. Heading left from the top of P4 accesses Wynona's Big Brown Beaver (5.9).

P5 30m 5.5 - 10 bolts
Climb up past bolts angling rightward to a large ledge that runs across the face of the climb.

P6 30m 5.8 - 14 bolts
Traverse right along the ledge past the rappel anchors and move up to a bolt. Climb up a short pedestal, clip bolt, and continue to make an upward traverse right past more bolts to belay.

P7/8 40m 5.8 - 12 bolts
Shared anchor with Hootenanny. Climb up through thin face moves to easier terrain. Use a long runner on the P8 anchors and continue out left towards a tree growing out over the roof. Climb the left side of the tree to gain the roof and move up to a tree belay.

Descent
From the tree belay move left along the ledge for approximately 5 meters and move down past a large tree making exposed moves down to a two ring bolt anchor. It's best to be roped up to get to the rappel anchors. From the anchor move down the wall 25 meters and angle climbers left a short ways to reach a small lip of rock just above where it gets steep. From here you can make five 30 meter rappels to the ground. It is possible to bail at the top of Pitch 2 and off the Pitch 5 ledge.



Hike up the trail to towards the base of the Exstew sport wall. After climbing the log staircase you will come to a massive boulder with a vertical face.  Look for a trail heading out left and follow flagging to a cave where the climb begins.  Work has recently been done to upgrade the belay stance at the cave. 

Bolts with rappel rings at rappel stations.

Home to three exceptional sport multipitch routes, this wall is located nearby the other other Exstew crags.  The start point for these climbs are in different locations so be careful to follow the correct trail depending on which route you plan to climb.  Recent work has been done to upgrade the Pitch 1 belay stance for Where the Wild Things Are/Winona's.
